newRemoveTagsResponse :: Int -> RemoveTagsResponse

-- | Contains a request for LookupEvents.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLookupEvents</a> smart constructor.
data LookupEvents
LookupEvents' :: Maybe EventCategory -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [LookupAttribute] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Natural -> LookupEvents

-- | Create a value of <a>LookupEvents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventCategory:LookupEvents'</a>,
--   <a>lookupEvents_eventCategory</a> - Specifies the event category. If
--   you do not specify an event category, events of the category are not
--   returned in the response. For example, if you do not specify
--   <tt>insight</tt> as the value of <tt>EventCategory</tt>, no Insights
--   events are returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:LookupEvents'</a>, <a>lookupEvents_startTime</a> -
--   Specifies that only events that occur after or at the specified time
--   are returned. If the specified start time is after the specified end
--   time, an error is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lookupAttributes:LookupEvents'</a>,
--   <a>lookupEvents_lookupAttributes</a> - Contains a list of lookup
--   attributes. Currently the list can contain only one item.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:LookupEvents'</a>, <a>lookupEvents_nextToken</a> -
--   The token to use to get the next page of results after a previous API
--   call. This token must be passed in with the same parameters that were
--   specified in the the original call. For example, if the original call
--   specified an AttributeKey of 'Username' with a value of 'root', the
--   call with NextToken should include those same parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:LookupEvents'</a>, <a>lookupEvents_endTime</a> -
--   Specifies that only events that occur before or at the specified time
--   are returned. If the specified end time is before the specified start
--   time, an error is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:LookupEvents'</a>, <a>lookupEvents_maxResults</a> -
--   The number of events to return. Possible values are 1 through 50. The
--   default is 50.
newLookupEvents :: LookupEvents

-- | Contains a response to a LookupEvents action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLookupEventsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data LookupEventsResponse
LookupEventsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Event] -> Int -> LookupEventsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>LookupEventsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:LookupEvents'</a>,
--   <a>lookupEventsResponse_nextToken</a> - The token to use to get the
--   next page of results after a previous API call. If the token does not
--   appear, there are no more results to return. The token must be passed
--   in with the same parameters as the previous call. For example, if the
--   original call specified an AttributeKey of 'Username' with a value of
--   'root', the call with NextToken should include those same parameters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:LookupEventsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>lookupEventsResponse_events</a> - A list of events returned based
--   on the lookup attributes specified and the CloudTrail event. The
--   events list is sorted by time. The most recent event is listed first.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:LookupEventsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>lookupEventsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newLookupEventsResponse :: Int -> LookupEventsResponse

-- | Passes the request to CloudTrail to stop logging Amazon Web Services
--   API calls for the specified account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopLogging</a> smart constructor.
data StopLogging
StopLogging' :: Text -> StopLogging

-- | Create a value of <a>StopLogging</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:StopLogging'</a>, <a>stopLogging_name</a> - Specifies the
--   name or the CloudTrail ARN of the trail for which CloudTrail will stop
--   logging Amazon Web Services API calls. The following is the format of
--   a trail ARN.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail
--   </pre>
newStopLogging :: Text -> StopLogging

-- | Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise,
--   returns an error.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStopLoggingResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StopLoggingResponse
StopLoggingResponse' :: Int -> StopLoggingResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>StopLoggingResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StopLoggingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>stopLoggingResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newStopLoggingResponse :: Int -> StopLoggingResponse

-- | The request that specifies the name of a trail to delete.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteTrail</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteTrail
DeleteTrail' :: Text -> DeleteTrail

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteTrail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DeleteTrail'</a>, <a>deleteTrail_name</a> - Specifies the
--   name or the CloudTrail ARN of the trail to be deleted. The following
--   is the format of a trail ARN.
--   <tt>arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail</tt>
newDeleteTrail :: Text -> DeleteTrail

-- | Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise,
--   returns an error.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteTrailResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteTrailResponse
DeleteTrailResponse' :: Int -> DeleteTrailResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteTrailResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteTrailResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newDeleteTrailResponse :: Int -> DeleteTrailResponse

-- | Specifies settings to update for the trail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateTrail</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateTrail
UpdateTrail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> UpdateTrail

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateTrail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:UpdateTrail'</a>, <a>updateTrail_s3KeyPrefix</a> -
--   Specifies the Amazon S3 key prefix that comes after the name of the
--   bucket you have designated for log file delivery. For more
--   information, see <a>Finding Your CloudTrail Log Files</a>. The maximum
--   length is 200 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicName:UpdateTrail'</a>, <a>updateTrail_snsTopicName</a>
--   - Specifies the name of the Amazon SNS topic defined for notification
--   of log file delivery. The maximum length is 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableLogFileValidation:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrail_enableLogFileValidation</a> - Specifies whether log
--   file validation is enabled. The default is false.
--   
--   When you disable log file integrity validation, the chain of digest
--   files is broken after one hour. CloudTrail does not create digest
--   files for log files that were delivered during a period in which log
--   file integrity validation was disabled. For example, if you enable log
--   file integrity validation at noon on January 1, disable it at noon on
--   January 2, and re-enable it at noon on January 10, digest files will
--   not be created for the log files delivered from noon on January 2 to
--   noon on January 10. The same applies whenever you stop CloudTrail
--   logging or delete a trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrail_cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn</a> - Specifies a log group
--   name using an Amazon Resource Name (ARN), a unique identifier that
--   represents the log group to which CloudTrail logs are delivered. Not
--   required unless you specify <tt>CloudWatchLogsRoleArn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:UpdateTrail'</a>, <a>updateTrail_kmsKeyId</a> -
--   Specifies the KMS key ID to use to encrypt the logs delivered by
--   CloudTrail. The value can be an alias name prefixed by "alias/", a
--   fully specified ARN to an alias, a fully specified ARN to a key, or a
--   globally unique identifier.
--   
--   CloudTrail also supports KMS multi-Region keys. For more information
--   about multi-Region keys, see <a>Using multi-Region keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>alias/MyAliasName</li>
--   <li>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:alias/MyAliasName</li>
--   
--   <li>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:key/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012</li>
--   <li>12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeGlobalServiceEvents:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrail_includeGlobalServiceEvents</a> - Specifies whether the
--   trail is publishing events from global services such as IAM to the log
--   files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isOrganizationTrail:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrail_isOrganizationTrail</a> - Specifies whether the trail
--   is applied to all accounts in an organization in Organizations, or
--   only for the current Amazon Web Services account. The default is
--   false, and cannot be true unless the call is made on behalf of an
--   Amazon Web Services account that is the management account for an
--   organization in Organizations. If the trail is not an organization
--   trail and this is set to <tt>true</tt>, the trail will be created in
--   all Amazon Web Services accounts that belong to the organization. If
--   the trail is an organization trail and this is set to <tt>false</tt>,
--   the trail will remain in the current Amazon Web Services account but
--   be deleted from all member accounts in the organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsRoleArn:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrail_cloudWatchLogsRoleArn</a> - Specifies the role for the
--   CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user's log group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:UpdateTrail'</a>, <a>updateTrail_s3BucketName</a>
--   - Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing
--   log files. See <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Naming Requirements</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMultiRegionTrail:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrail_isMultiRegionTrail</a> - Specifies whether the trail
--   applies only to the current region or to all regions. The default is
--   false. If the trail exists only in the current region and this value
--   is set to true, shadow trails (replications of the trail) will be
--   created in the other regions. If the trail exists in all regions and
--   this value is set to false, the trail will remain in the region where
--   it was created, and its shadow trails in other regions will be
--   deleted. As a best practice, consider using trails that log events in
--   all regions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateTrail'</a>, <a>updateTrail_name</a> - Specifies the
--   name of the trail or trail ARN. If <tt>Name</tt> is a trail name, the
--   string must meet the following requirements:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), periods (.),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-)</li>
--   <li>Start with a letter or number, and end with a letter or
--   number</li>
--   <li>Be between 3 and 128 characters</li>
--   <li>Have no adjacent periods, underscores or dashes. Names like
--   <tt>my-_namespace</tt> and <tt>my--namespace</tt> are not valid.</li>
--   <li>Not be in IP address format (for example, 192.168.5.4)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <tt>Name</tt> is a trail ARN, it must be in the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail
--   </pre>
newUpdateTrail :: Text -> UpdateTrail

-- | Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise,
--   returns an error.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateTrailResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateTrailResponse
UpdateTrailResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Int -> UpdateTrailResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateTrailResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logFileValidationEnabled:UpdateTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_logFileValidationEnabled</a> - Specifies
--   whether log file integrity validation is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailARN:UpdateTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_trailARN</a> - Specifies the ARN of the trail
--   that was updated. The following is the format of a trail ARN.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_s3KeyPrefix</a> - Specifies the Amazon S3 key
--   prefix that comes after the name of the bucket you have designated for
--   log file delivery. For more information, see <a>Finding Your IAM Log
--   Files</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicARN:UpdateTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_snsTopicARN</a> - Specifies the ARN of the
--   Amazon SNS topic that CloudTrail uses to send notifications when log
--   files are delivered. The following is the format of a topic ARN.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:sns:us-east-2:123456789012:MyTopic
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicName:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_snsTopicName</a> - This field is no longer in
--   use. Use UpdateTrailResponse$SnsTopicARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn</a> - Specifies the
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log group to which CloudTrail logs
--   are delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:UpdateTrail'</a>, <a>updateTrailResponse_kmsKeyId</a>
--   - Specifies the KMS key ID that encrypts the logs delivered by
--   CloudTrail. The value is a fully specified ARN to a KMS key in the
--   following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:key/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:UpdateTrail'</a>, <a>updateTrailResponse_name</a> -
--   Specifies the name of the trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeGlobalServiceEvents:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_includeGlobalServiceEvents</a> - Specifies
--   whether the trail is publishing events from global services such as
--   IAM to the log files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isOrganizationTrail:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_isOrganizationTrail</a> - Specifies whether the
--   trail is an organization trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsRoleArn:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_cloudWatchLogsRoleArn</a> - Specifies the role
--   for the CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user's log
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_s3BucketName</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing log files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMultiRegionTrail:UpdateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_isMultiRegionTrail</a> - Specifies whether the
--   trail exists in one region or in all regions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateTrailResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateTrailResponse :: Int -> UpdateTrailResponse

-- | Specifies the settings for each trail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTrail</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTrail
CreateTrail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> CreateTrail

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTrail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrail_s3KeyPrefix</a> -
--   Specifies the Amazon S3 key prefix that comes after the name of the
--   bucket you have designated for log file delivery. For more
--   information, see <a>Finding Your CloudTrail Log Files</a>. The maximum
--   length is 200 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicName:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrail_snsTopicName</a>
--   - Specifies the name of the Amazon SNS topic defined for notification
--   of log file delivery. The maximum length is 256 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableLogFileValidation:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrail_enableLogFileValidation</a> - Specifies whether log
--   file integrity validation is enabled. The default is false.
--   
--   When you disable log file integrity validation, the chain of digest
--   files is broken after one hour. CloudTrail does not create digest
--   files for log files that were delivered during a period in which log
--   file integrity validation was disabled. For example, if you enable log
--   file integrity validation at noon on January 1, disable it at noon on
--   January 2, and re-enable it at noon on January 10, digest files will
--   not be created for the log files delivered from noon on January 2 to
--   noon on January 10. The same applies whenever you stop CloudTrail
--   logging or delete a trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrail_cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn</a> - Specifies a log group
--   name using an Amazon Resource Name (ARN), a unique identifier that
--   represents the log group to which CloudTrail logs will be delivered.
--   Not required unless you specify <tt>CloudWatchLogsRoleArn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrail_kmsKeyId</a> -
--   Specifies the KMS key ID to use to encrypt the logs delivered by
--   CloudTrail. The value can be an alias name prefixed by "alias/", a
--   fully specified ARN to an alias, a fully specified ARN to a key, or a
--   globally unique identifier.
--   
--   CloudTrail also supports KMS multi-Region keys. For more information
--   about multi-Region keys, see <a>Using multi-Region keys</a> in the
--   <i>Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>alias/MyAliasName</li>
--   <li>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:alias/MyAliasName</li>
--   
--   <li>arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:key/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012</li>
--   <li>12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeGlobalServiceEvents:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrail_includeGlobalServiceEvents</a> - Specifies whether the
--   trail is publishing events from global services such as IAM to the log
--   files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagsList:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrail_tagsList</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isOrganizationTrail:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrail_isOrganizationTrail</a> - Specifies whether the trail
--   is created for all accounts in an organization in Organizations, or
--   only for the current Amazon Web Services account. The default is
--   false, and cannot be true unless the call is made on behalf of an
--   Amazon Web Services account that is the management account for an
--   organization in Organizations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsRoleArn:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrail_cloudWatchLogsRoleArn</a> - Specifies the role for the
--   CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user's log group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMultiRegionTrail:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrail_isMultiRegionTrail</a> - Specifies whether the trail is
--   created in the current region or in all regions. The default is false,
--   which creates a trail only in the region where you are signed in. As a
--   best practice, consider creating trails that log events in all
--   regions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrail_name</a> - Specifies the
--   name of the trail. The name must meet the following requirements:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), periods (.),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-)</li>
--   <li>Start with a letter or number, and end with a letter or
--   number</li>
--   <li>Be between 3 and 128 characters</li>
--   <li>Have no adjacent periods, underscores or dashes. Names like
--   <tt>my-_namespace</tt> and <tt>my--namespace</tt> are not valid.</li>
--   <li>Not be in IP address format (for example, 192.168.5.4)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrail_s3BucketName</a>
--   - Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing
--   log files. See <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Naming Requirements</a>.
newCreateTrail :: Text -> Text -> CreateTrail

-- | Returns the objects or data listed below if successful. Otherwise,
--   returns an error.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateTrailResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateTrailResponse
CreateTrailResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Int -> CreateTrailResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateTrailResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   whether log file integrity validation is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailARN:CreateTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_trailARN</a> - Specifies the ARN of the trail
--   that was created. The format of a trail ARN is:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_s3KeyPrefix</a> - Specifies the Amazon S3 key
--   prefix that comes after the name of the bucket you have designated for

--   CloudTrail Log Files</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicARN:CreateTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_snsTopicARN</a> - Specifies the ARN of the
--   Amazon SNS topic that CloudTrail uses to send notifications when log
--   files are delivered. The format of a topic ARN is:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:sns:us-east-2:123456789012:MyTopic
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicName:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_snsTopicName</a> - This field is no longer in
--   use. Use SnsTopicARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn</a> - Specifies the
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log group to which CloudTrail logs
--   will be delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrailResponse_kmsKeyId</a>

--   CloudTrail. The value is a fully specified ARN to a KMS key in the
--   following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:key/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateTrail'</a>, <a>createTrailResponse_name</a> -
--   Specifies the name of the trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeGlobalServiceEvents:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_includeGlobalServiceEvents</a> - Specifies
--   whether the trail is publishing events from global services such as
--   IAM to the log files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isOrganizationTrail:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_isOrganizationTrail</a> - Specifies whether the

--

--   for the CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user's log
--   group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_s3BucketName</a> - Specifies the name of the
--   Amazon S3 bucket designated for publishing log files.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMultiRegionTrail:CreateTrail'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_isMultiRegionTrail</a> - Specifies whether the
--   trail exists in one region or in all regions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateTrailResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createTrailResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateTrailResponse :: Int -> CreateTrailResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutInsightSelectors</a> smart constructor.
data PutInsightSelectors
PutInsightSelectors' :: Text -> [InsightSelector] -> PutInsightSelectors

-- | Create a value of <a>PutInsightSelectors</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailName:PutInsightSelectors'</a>,
--   <a>putInsightSelectors_trailName</a> - The name of the CloudTrail
--   trail for which you want to change or add Insights selectors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:insightSelectors:PutInsightSelectors'</a>,
--   <a>putInsightSelectors_insightSelectors</a> - A JSON string that
--   contains the Insights types that you want to log on a trail. The valid
--   Insights type in this release is <tt>ApiCallRateInsight</tt>.
newPutInsightSelectors :: Text -> PutInsightSelectors

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPutInsightSelectorsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PutInsightSelectorsResponse
PutInsightSelectorsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [InsightSelector] -> Int -> PutInsightSelectorsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PutInsightSelectorsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailARN:PutInsightSelectorsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putInsightSelectorsResponse_trailARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of a trail for which you want to change or add Insights
--   selectors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:insightSelectors:PutInsightSelectors'</a>,
--   <a>putInsightSelectorsResponse_insightSelectors</a> - A JSON string
--   that contains the Insights event types that you want to log on a
--   trail. The valid Insights type in this release is
--   <tt>ApiCallRateInsight</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PutInsightSelectorsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>putInsightSelectorsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newPutInsightSelectorsResponse :: Int -> PutInsightSelectorsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEventSelectors</a> smart constructor.
data GetEventSelectors
GetEventSelectors' :: Text -> GetEventSelectors

-- | Create a value of <a>GetEventSelectors</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailName:GetEventSelectors'</a>,
--   <a>getEventSelectors_trailName</a> - Specifies the name of the trail
--   or trail ARN. If you specify a trail name, the string must meet the
--   following requirements:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), periods (.),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-)</li>
--   <li>Start with a letter or number, and end with a letter or
--   number</li>
--   <li>Be between 3 and 128 characters</li>
--   <li>Have no adjacent periods, underscores or dashes. Names like
--   <tt>my-_namespace</tt> and <tt>my--namespace</tt> are not valid.</li>
--   <li>Not be in IP address format (for example, 192.168.5.4)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you specify a trail ARN, it must be in the format:
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail
--   </pre>
newGetEventSelectors :: Text -> GetEventSelectors

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetEventSelectorsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetEventSelectorsResponse
GetEventSelectorsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [EventSelector] -> Maybe [AdvancedEventSelector] -> Int -> GetEventSelectorsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetEventSelectorsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailARN:GetEventSelectorsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEventSelectorsResponse_trailARN</a> - The specified trail ARN
--   that has the event selectors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventSelectors:GetEventSelectorsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEventSelectorsResponse_eventSelectors</a> - The event selectors
--   that are configured for the trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:advancedEventSelectors:GetEventSelectorsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEventSelectorsResponse_advancedEventSelectors</a> - The advanced
--   event selectors that are configured for the trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetEventSelectorsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getEventSelectorsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetEventSelectorsResponse :: Int -> GetEventSelectorsResponse

--   replication of the trail in another region), you must specify its ARN.

--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeLoggingStopped:GetTrailStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTrailStatusResponse_timeLoggingStopped</a> - This field is no
--   longer in use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestDeliveryError:GetTrailStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTrailStatusResponse_latestDeliveryError</a> - Displays any
--   Amazon S3 error that CloudTrail encountered when attempting to deliver
--   log files to the designated bucket. For more information, see <a>Error
--   Responses</a> in the Amazon S3 API Reference.
--   
--   This error occurs only when there is a problem with the destination S3
--   bucket, and does not occur for requests that time out. To resolve the
--   issue, create a new bucket, and then call <tt>UpdateTrail</tt> to
--   specify the new bucket; or fix the existing objects so that CloudTrail
--   can again write to the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestDigestDeliveryTime:GetTrailStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTrailStatusResponse_latestDigestDeliveryTime</a> - Specifies the
--   date and time that CloudTrail last delivered a digest file to an
--   account's Amazon S3 bucket.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestNotificationAttemptSucceeded:GetTrailStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTrailStatusResponse_latestNotificationAttemptSucceeded</a> -
--   This field is no longer in use.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startLoggingTime:GetTrailStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTrailStatusResponse_startLoggingTime</a> - Specifies the most
--   recent date and time when CloudTrail started recording API calls for
--   an Amazon Web Services account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestNotificationError:GetTrailStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getTrailStatusResponse_latestNotificationError</a> - Displays any

--   <a>Amazon SNS Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestDeliveryAttemptSucceeded:GetTrailStatusResponse'</a>,

--   field is no longer in use.
--

--   longer in use.

newGetTrailStatusResponse :: Int -> GetTrailStatusResponse

data PutEventSelectors
PutEventSelectors' :: Maybe [EventSelector] -> Maybe [AdvancedEventSelector] -> Text -> PutEventSelectors

-- | Create a value of <a>PutEventSelectors</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventSelectors:PutEventSelectors'</a>,
--   <a>putEventSelectors_eventSelectors</a> - Specifies the settings for
--   your event selectors. You can configure up to five event selectors for
--   a trail. You can use either <tt>EventSelectors</tt> or
--   <tt>AdvancedEventSelectors</tt> in a <tt>PutEventSelectors</tt>
--   request, but not both. If you apply <tt>EventSelectors</tt> to a
--   trail, any existing <tt>AdvancedEventSelectors</tt> are overwritten.
--   
--   <a>$sel:advancedEventSelectors:PutEventSelectors'</a>,
--   <a>putEventSelectors_advancedEventSelectors</a> - Specifies the
--   settings for advanced event selectors. You can add advanced event
--   selectors, and conditions for your advanced event selectors, up to a
--   maximum of 500 values for all conditions and selectors on a trail. You
--   can use either <tt>AdvancedEventSelectors</tt> or
--   <tt>EventSelectors</tt>, but not both. If you apply
--   <tt>AdvancedEventSelectors</tt> to a trail, any existing
--   <tt>EventSelectors</tt> are overwritten. For more information about
--   advanced event selectors, see <a>Logging data events for trails</a> in
--   the <i>CloudTrail User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailName:PutEventSelectors'</a>,
--   <a>putEventSelectors_trailName</a> - Specifies the name of the trail
--   or trail ARN. If you specify a trail name, the string must meet the
--   following requirements:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Contain only ASCII letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), periods (.),
--   underscores (_), or dashes (-)</li>
--   <li>Start with a letter or number, and end with a letter or
--   number</li>
--   <li>Be between 3 and 128 characters</li>
--   <li>Have no adjacent periods, underscores or dashes. Names like
--   <tt>my-_namespace</tt> and <tt>my--namespace</tt> are not valid.</li>
--   <li>Not be in IP address format (for example, 192.168.5.4)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you specify a trail ARN, it must be in the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail
--   </pre>

newtype EventCategory
EventCategory' :: Text -> EventCategory
[fromEventCategory] :: EventCategory -> Text
pattern EventCategory_Insight :: EventCategory
newtype InsightType
InsightType' :: Text -> InsightType
[fromInsightType] :: InsightType -> Text
pattern InsightType_ApiCallRateInsight :: InsightType
newtype LookupAttributeKey
LookupAttributeKey' :: Text -> LookupAttributeKey
[fromLookupAttributeKey] :: LookupAttributeKey -> Text
pattern LookupAttributeKey_AccessKeyId :: LookupAttributeKey
pattern LookupAttributeKey_EventId :: LookupAttributeKey
pattern LookupAttributeKey_EventName :: LookupAttributeKey
pattern LookupAttributeKey_EventSource :: LookupAttributeKey
pattern LookupAttributeKey_ReadOnly :: LookupAttributeKey
pattern LookupAttributeKey_ResourceName :: LookupAttributeKey
pattern LookupAttributeKey_ResourceType :: LookupAttributeKey
pattern LookupAttributeKey_Username :: LookupAttributeKey
newtype ReadWriteType
ReadWriteType' :: Text -> ReadWriteType
[fromReadWriteType] :: ReadWriteType -> Text
pattern ReadWriteType_All :: ReadWriteType
pattern ReadWriteType_ReadOnly :: ReadWriteType
pattern ReadWriteType_WriteOnly :: ReadWriteType

-- | Advanced event selectors let you create fine-grained selectors for the
--   following CloudTrail event record ﬁelds. They help you control costs
--   by logging only those events that are important to you. For more
--   information about advanced event selectors, see <a>Logging data events
--   for trails</a> in the <i>CloudTrail User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>readOnly</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>eventSource</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>eventName</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>eventCategory</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>resources.type</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>resources.ARN</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   You cannot apply both event selectors and advanced event selectors to
--   a trail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdvancedEventSelector</a> smart constructor.
data AdvancedEventSelector
AdvancedEventSelector' :: Maybe Text -> NonEmpty AdvancedFieldSelector -> AdvancedEventSelector

-- | Create a value of <a>AdvancedEventSelector</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AdvancedEventSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedEventSelector_name</a> - An optional, descriptive name for
--   an advanced event selector, such as "Log data events for only two S3
--   buckets".
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldSelectors:AdvancedEventSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedEventSelector_fieldSelectors</a> - Contains all selector
--   statements in an advanced event selector.
newAdvancedEventSelector :: NonEmpty AdvancedFieldSelector -> AdvancedEventSelector

-- | A single selector statement in an advanced event selector.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAdvancedFieldSelector</a> smart constructor.
data AdvancedFieldSelector
AdvancedFieldSelector' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Text -> AdvancedFieldSelector

-- | Create a value of <a>AdvancedFieldSelector</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endsWith:AdvancedFieldSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedFieldSelector_endsWith</a> - An operator that includes
--   events that match the last few characters of the event record field
--   specified as the value of <tt>Field</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notStartsWith:AdvancedFieldSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedFieldSelector_notStartsWith</a> - An operator that excludes
--   events that match the first few characters of the event record field
--   specified as the value of <tt>Field</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:equals:AdvancedFieldSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedFieldSelector_equals</a> - An operator that includes events
--   that match the exact value of the event record field specified as the
--   value of <tt>Field</tt>. This is the only valid operator that you can
--   use with the <tt>readOnly</tt>, <tt>eventCategory</tt>, and
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> fields.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notEquals:AdvancedFieldSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedFieldSelector_notEquals</a> - An operator that excludes
--   events that match the exact value of the event record field specified
--   as the value of <tt>Field</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notEndsWith:AdvancedFieldSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedFieldSelector_notEndsWith</a> - An operator that excludes
--   events that match the last few characters of the event record field
--   specified as the value of <tt>Field</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startsWith:AdvancedFieldSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedFieldSelector_startsWith</a> - An operator that includes
--   events that match the first few characters of the event record field
--   specified as the value of <tt>Field</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:field:AdvancedFieldSelector'</a>,
--   <a>advancedFieldSelector_field</a> - A field in an event record on
--   which to filter events to be logged. Supported fields include
--   <tt>readOnly</tt>, <tt>eventCategory</tt>, <tt>eventSource</tt> (for
--   management events), <tt>eventName</tt>, <tt>resources.type</tt>, and
--   <tt>resources.ARN</tt>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>readOnly</tt></b> - Optional. Can be set to <tt>Equals</tt>
--   a value of <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt>. A value of <tt>false</tt>
--   logs both <tt>read</tt> and <tt>write</tt> events.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>eventSource</tt></b> - For filtering management events
--   only. This can be set only to <tt>NotEquals</tt>
--   <tt>kms.amazonaws.com</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>eventName</tt></b> - Can use any operator. You can use it
--   to ﬁlter in or ﬁlter out any data event logged to CloudTrail, such as
--   <tt>PutBucket</tt> or <tt>GetSnapshotBlock</tt>. You can have multiple
--   values for this ﬁeld, separated by commas.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>eventCategory</tt></b> - This is required. It must be set
--   to <tt>Equals</tt>, and the value must be <tt>Management</tt> or
--   <tt>Data</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>resources.type</tt></b> - This ﬁeld is required.
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> can only use the <tt>Equals</tt> operator, and
--   the value can be one of the following: <tt>AWS::S3::Object</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::S3::AccessPoint</tt>, <tt>AWS::Lambda::Function</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::DynamoDB::Table</tt>, <tt>AWS::S3Outposts::Object</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::ManagedBlockchain::Node</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::S3ObjectLambda::AccessPoint</tt>, or
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Snapshot</tt>. You can have only one
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> ﬁeld per selector. To log data events on more
--   than one resource type, add another selector.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>resources.ARN</tt></b> - You can use any operator with
--   resources.ARN, but if you use <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>,
--   the value must exactly match the ARN of a valid resource of the type
--   you've speciﬁed in the template as the value of resources.type. For
--   example, if resources.type equals <tt>AWS::S3::Object</tt>, the ARN
--   must be in one of the following formats. To log all data events for
--   all objects in a specific S3 bucket, use the <tt>StartsWith</tt>
--   operator, and include only the bucket ARN as the matching value.The
--   trailing slash is intentional; do not exclude it. Replace the text
--   between less than and greater than symbols (&lt;&gt;) with
--   resource-specific
--   information.<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:s3:::&lt;bucket_name&gt;/</pre></li><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:s3:::&lt;bucket_name&gt;/&lt;object_path&gt;/</pre></li></ul>When
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> equals <tt>AWS::S3::AccessPoint</tt>, and the
--   operator is set to <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>, the ARN must
--   be in one of the following formats. To log events on all objects in an
--   S3 access point, we recommend that you use only the access point ARN,
--   don’t include the object path, and use the <tt>StartsWith</tt> or
--   <tt>NotStartsWith</tt>
--   operators.<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:s3:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account_ID&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access_point_name&gt;</pre></li><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:s3:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account_ID&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access_point_name&gt;/object/&lt;object_path&gt;</pre></li></ul>When
--   resources.type equals <tt>AWS::Lambda::Function</tt>, and the operator
--   is set to <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>, the ARN must be in
--   the following
--   format:<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:lambda:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account_ID&gt;:function:&lt;function_name&gt;</pre></li></ul>When
--   resources.type equals <tt>AWS::DynamoDB::Table</tt>, and the operator
--   is set to <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>, the ARN must be in
--   the following
--   format:<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:dynamodb:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account_ID&gt;:table:&lt;table_name&gt;</pre></li></ul>When
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> equals <tt>AWS::S3Outposts::Object</tt>, and
--   the operator is set to <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>, the ARN
--   must be in the following
--   format:<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:s3-outposts:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account_ID&gt;:&lt;object_path&gt;</pre></li></ul>When
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> equals <tt>AWS::ManagedBlockchain::Node</tt>,
--   and the operator is set to <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>, the
--   ARN must be in the following
--   format:<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:managedblockchain:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account_ID&gt;:nodes/&lt;node_ID&gt;</pre></li></ul>When
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> equals
--   <tt>AWS::S3ObjectLambda::AccessPoint</tt>, and the operator is set to
--   <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>, the ARN must be in the
--   following
--   format:<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:s3-object-lambda:&lt;region&gt;:&lt;account_ID&gt;:accesspoint/&lt;access_point_name&gt;</pre></li></ul>When
--   <tt>resources.type</tt> equals <tt>AWS::EC2::Snapshot</tt>, and the
--   operator is set to <tt>Equals</tt> or <tt>NotEquals</tt>, the ARN must
--   be in the following
--   format:<ul><li><pre>arn:&lt;partition&gt;:ec2:&lt;region&gt;::snapshot/&lt;snapshot_ID&gt;</pre></li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
newAdvancedFieldSelector :: Text -> AdvancedFieldSelector

-- | The Amazon S3 buckets, Lambda functions, or Amazon DynamoDB tables
--   that you specify in your event selectors for your trail to log data
--   events. Data events provide information about the resource operations
--   performed on or within a resource itself. These are also known as data
--   plane operations. You can specify up to 250 data resources for a
--   trail.
--   
--   The total number of allowed data resources is 250. This number can be
--   distributed between 1 and 5 event selectors, but the total cannot
--   exceed 250 across all selectors.
--   
--   If you are using advanced event selectors, the maximum total number of
--   values for all conditions, across all advanced event selectors for the
--   trail, is 500.
--   
--   The following example demonstrates how logging works when you
--   configure logging of all data events for an S3 bucket named
--   <tt>bucket-1</tt>. In this example, the CloudTrail user specified an
--   empty prefix, and the option to log both <tt>Read</tt> and
--   <tt>Write</tt> data events.
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>A user uploads an image file to <tt>bucket-1</tt>.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>PutObject</tt> API operation is an Amazon S3 object-level
--   API. It is recorded as a data event in CloudTrail. Because the
--   CloudTrail user specified an S3 bucket with an empty prefix, events
--   that occur on any object in that bucket are logged. The trail
--   processes and logs the event.</li>
--   <li>A user uploads an object to an Amazon S3 bucket named
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:::bucket-2</tt>.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>PutObject</tt> API operation occurred for an object in an
--   S3 bucket that the CloudTrail user didn't specify for the trail. The
--   trail doesn’t log the event.</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   The following example demonstrates how logging works when you
--   configure logging of Lambda data events for a Lambda function named
--   <i>MyLambdaFunction</i>, but not for all Lambda functions.
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>A user runs a script that includes a call to the
--   <i>MyLambdaFunction</i> function and the <i>MyOtherLambdaFunction</i>
--   function.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>Invoke</tt> API operation on <i>MyLambdaFunction</i> is an
--   Lambda API. It is recorded as a data event in CloudTrail. Because the
--   CloudTrail user specified logging data events for
--   <i>MyLambdaFunction</i>, any invocations of that function are logged.
--   The trail processes and logs the event.</li>
--   <li>The <tt>Invoke</tt> API operation on <i>MyOtherLambdaFunction</i>
--   is an Lambda API. Because the CloudTrail user did not specify logging
--   data events for all Lambda functions, the <tt>Invoke</tt> operation
--   for <i>MyOtherLambdaFunction</i> does not match the function specified
--   for the trail. The trail doesn’t log the event.</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataResource</a> smart constructor.
data DataResource
DataResource' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> DataResource

-- | Create a value of <a>DataResource</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:values:DataResource'</a>, <a>dataResource_values</a> - An
--   array of Amazon Resource Name (ARN) strings or partial ARN strings for
--   the specified objects.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To log data events for all objects in all S3 buckets in your
--   Amazon Web Services account, specify the prefix as
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:::</tt>.This also enables logging of data event
--   activity performed by any user or role in your Amazon Web Services
--   account, even if that activity is performed on a bucket that belongs
--   to another Amazon Web Services account.</li>
--   <li>To log data events for all objects in an S3 bucket, specify the
--   bucket and an empty object prefix such as
--   <tt>arn:aws:s3:::bucket-1/</tt>. The trail logs data events for all
--   objects in this S3 bucket.</li>
--   <li>To log data events for specific objects, specify the S3 bucket and
--   object prefix such as <tt>arn:aws:s3:::bucket-1/example-images</tt>.
--   The trail logs data events for objects in this S3 bucket that match
--   the prefix.</li>
--   <li>To log data events for all Lambda functions in your Amazon Web
--   Services account, specify the prefix as <tt>arn:aws:lambda</tt>.This
--   also enables logging of <tt>Invoke</tt> activity performed by any user
--   or role in your Amazon Web Services account, even if that activity is
--   performed on a function that belongs to another Amazon Web Services
--   account.</li>
--   <li>To log data events for a specific Lambda function, specify the
--   function ARN.Lambda function ARNs are exact. For example, if you
--   specify a function ARN
--   <i>arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:111111111111:function:helloworld</i>, data
--   events will only be logged for
--   <i>arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:111111111111:function:helloworld</i>. They
--   will not be logged for
--   <i>arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:111111111111:function:helloworld2</i>.</li>
--   <li>To log data events for all DynamoDB tables in your Amazon Web
--   Services account, specify the prefix as
--   <tt>arn:aws:dynamodb</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DataResource'</a>, <a>dataResource_type</a> - The
--   resource type in which you want to log data events. You can specify
--   <tt>AWS::S3::Object</tt>, <tt>AWS::Lambda::Function</tt>, or
--   <tt>AWS::DynamoDB::Table</tt> resources.
--   
--   The <tt>AWS::S3Outposts::Object</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::ManagedBlockchain::Node</tt>,
--   <tt>AWS::S3ObjectLambda::AccessPoint</tt>, and
--   <tt>AWS::EC2::Snapshot</tt> resource types are not valid in basic
--   event selectors. To log data events on these resource types, use
--   advanced event selectors.
newDataResource :: DataResource

-- | Contains information about an event that was returned by a lookup
--   request. The result includes a representation of a CloudTrail event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvent</a> smart constructor.
data Event
Event' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Resource] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Event

-- | Create a value of <a>Event</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:Event'</a>, <a>event_username</a> - A user name or
--   role name of the requester that called the API in the event returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resources:Event'</a>, <a>event_resources</a> - A list of
--   resources referenced by the event returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventTime:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventTime</a> - The date and
--   time of the event returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudTrailEvent:Event'</a>, <a>event_cloudTrailEvent</a> - A
--   JSON string that contains a representation of the event returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventName:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventName</a> - The name of the
--   event returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readOnly:Event'</a>, <a>event_readOnly</a> - Information about
--   whether the event is a write event or a read event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:Event'</a>, <a>event_accessKeyId</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services access key ID that was used to sign the request. If the
--   request was made with temporary security credentials, this is the
--   access key ID of the temporary credentials.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventSource:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventSource</a> - The Amazon
--   Web Services service to which the request was made.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eventId:Event'</a>, <a>event_eventId</a> - The CloudTrail ID
--   of the event returned.
newEvent :: Event

-- | Use event selectors to further specify the management and data event
--   settings for your trail. By default, trails created without specific
--   event selectors will be configured to log all read and write
--   management events, and no data events. When an event occurs in your
--   account, CloudTrail evaluates the event selector for all trails. For
--   each trail, if the event matches any event selector, the trail
--   processes and logs the event. If the event doesn't match any event
--   selector, the trail doesn't log the event.
--   
--   You can configure up to five event selectors for a trail.
--   
--   You cannot apply both event selectors and advanced event selectors to
--   a trail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEventSelector</a> smart constructor.
data EventSelector
EventSelector' :: Maybe [DataResource] -> Maybe ReadWriteType -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Bool -> EventSelector

-- | Create a value of <a>EventSelector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataResources:EventSelector'</a>,
--   <a>eventSelector_dataResources</a> - CloudTrail supports data event
--   logging for Amazon S3 objects, Lambda functions, and Amazon DynamoDB
--   tables with basic event selectors. You can specify up to 250 resources
--   for an individual event selector, but the total number of data
--   resources cannot exceed 250 across all event selectors in a trail.
--   This limit does not apply if you configure resource logging for all
--   data events.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Data Events</a> and <a>Limits in
--   CloudTrail</a> in the <i>CloudTrail User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readWriteType:EventSelector'</a>,
--   <a>eventSelector_readWriteType</a> - Specify if you want your trail to
--   log read-only events, write-only events, or all. For example, the EC2
--   <tt>GetConsoleOutput</tt> is a read-only API operation and
--   <tt>RunInstances</tt> is a write-only API operation.
--   
--   By default, the value is <tt>All</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:excludeManagementEventSources:EventSelector'</a>,
--   <a>eventSelector_excludeManagementEventSources</a> - An optional list
--   of service event sources from which you do not want management events
--   to be logged on your trail. In this release, the list can be empty
--   (disables the filter), or it can filter out Key Management Service or
--   Amazon RDS Data API events by containing <tt>kms.amazonaws.com</tt> or
--   <tt>rdsdata.amazonaws.com</tt>. By default,
--   <tt>ExcludeManagementEventSources</tt> is empty, and KMS and Amazon
--   RDS Data API events are logged to your trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeManagementEvents:EventSelector'</a>,
--   <a>eventSelector_includeManagementEvents</a> - Specify if you want
--   your event selector to include management events for your trail.
--   
--   For more information, see <a>Management Events</a> in the
--   <i>CloudTrail User Guide</i>.
--   
--   By default, the value is <tt>true</tt>.
--   
--   The first copy of management events is free. You are charged for
--   additional copies of management events that you are logging on any
--   subsequent trail in the same region. For more information about
--   CloudTrail pricing, see <a>CloudTrail Pricing</a>.
newEventSelector :: EventSelector

-- | A JSON string that contains a list of insight types that are logged on
--   a trail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInsightSelector</a> smart constructor.
data InsightSelector
InsightSelector' :: Maybe InsightType -> InsightSelector

-- | Create a value of <a>InsightSelector</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:insightType:InsightSelector'</a>,
--   <a>insightSelector_insightType</a> - The type of Insights events to
--   log on a trail. The valid Insights type in this release is
--   <tt>ApiCallRateInsight</tt>.
newInsightSelector :: InsightSelector

-- | Specifies an attribute and value that filter the events returned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLookupAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data LookupAttribute
LookupAttribute' :: LookupAttributeKey -> Text -> LookupAttribute

-- | Create a value of <a>LookupAttribute</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeKey:LookupAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>lookupAttribute_attributeKey</a> - Specifies an attribute on which
--   to filter the events returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeValue:LookupAttribute'</a>,
--   <a>lookupAttribute_attributeValue</a> - Specifies a value for the
--   specified AttributeKey.
newLookupAttribute :: LookupAttributeKey -> Text -> LookupAttribute

-- | Contains information about a returned public key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPublicKey</a> smart constructor.
data PublicKey
PublicKey' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Base64 -> Maybe POSIX -> PublicKey

-- | Create a value of <a>PublicKey</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fingerprint:PublicKey'</a>, <a>publicKey_fingerprint</a> - The
--   fingerprint of the public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validityEndTime:PublicKey'</a>,
--   <a>publicKey_validityEndTime</a> - The ending time of validity of the
--   public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:PublicKey'</a>, <a>publicKey_value</a> - The DER encoded
--   public key value in PKCS#1 format.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The
--   underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:validityStartTime:PublicKey'</a>,
--   <a>publicKey_validityStartTime</a> - The starting time of validity of
--   the public key.
newPublicKey :: PublicKey

-- | Specifies the type and name of a resource referenced by an event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResource</a> smart constructor.
data Resource
Resource' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Resource

-- | Create a value of <a>Resource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Resource'</a>, <a>resource_resourceType</a> - The
--   type of a resource referenced by the event returned. When the resource
--   type cannot be determined, null is returned. Some examples of resource
--   types are: <b>Instance</b> for EC2, <b>Trail</b> for CloudTrail,
--   <b>DBInstance</b> for Amazon RDS, and <b>AccessKey</b> for IAM. To
--   learn more about how to look up and filter events by the resource
--   types supported for a service, see <a>Filtering CloudTrail Events</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceName:Resource'</a>, <a>resource_resourceName</a> - The
--   name of the resource referenced by the event returned. These are
--   user-created names whose values will depend on the environment. For
--   example, the resource name might be "auto-scaling-test-group" for an
--   Auto Scaling Group or "i-1234567" for an EC2 Instance.
newResource :: Resource

-- | A resource tag.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceTag</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceTag
ResourceTag' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> ResourceTag

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceId:ResourceTag'</a>, <a>resourceTag_resourceId</a> -
--   Specifies the ARN of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagsList:ResourceTag'</a>, <a>resourceTag_tagsList</a> - A
--   list of tags.
newResourceTag :: ResourceTag

-- | A custom key-value pair associated with a resource such as a
--   CloudTrail trail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value in a key-value
--   pair of a tag. The value must be no longer than 256 Unicode
--   characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key in a key-value pair.
--   The key must be must be no longer than 128 Unicode characters. The key
--   must be unique for the resource to which it applies.
newTag :: Text -> Tag

-- | The settings for a trail.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrail</a> smart constructor.
data Trail
Trail' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Trail

-- | Create a value of <a>Trail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:logFileValidationEnabled:Trail'</a>,
--   <a>trail_logFileValidationEnabled</a> - Specifies whether log file
--   validation is enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailARN:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_trailARN</a> - Specifies the ARN
--   of the trail. The following is the format of a trail ARN.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:cloudtrail:us-east-2:123456789012:trail/MyTrail
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3KeyPrefix:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_s3KeyPrefix</a> - Specifies
--   the Amazon S3 key prefix that comes after the name of the bucket you
--   have designated for log file delivery. For more information, see
--   <a>Finding Your CloudTrail Log Files</a>. The maximum length is 200
--   characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasInsightSelectors:Trail'</a>,
--   <a>trail_hasInsightSelectors</a> - Specifies whether a trail has
--   insight types specified in an <tt>InsightSelector</tt> list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicARN:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_snsTopicARN</a> - Specifies
--   the ARN of the Amazon SNS topic that CloudTrail uses to send
--   notifications when log files are delivered. The following is the
--   format of a topic ARN.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:sns:us-east-2:123456789012:MyTopic
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:snsTopicName:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_snsTopicName</a> - This
--   field is no longer in use. Use SnsTopicARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn:Trail'</a>,
--   <a>trail_cloudWatchLogsLogGroupArn</a> - Specifies an Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN), a unique identifier that represents the log group to which
--   CloudTrail logs will be delivered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_kmsKeyId</a> - Specifies the KMS
--   key ID that encrypts the logs delivered by CloudTrail. The value is a
--   fully specified ARN to a KMS key in the following format.
--   
--   <pre>
--   arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:123456789012:key/12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>$sel:homeRegion:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_homeRegion</a> - The region in
--   which the trail was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_name</a> - Name of the trail set by
--   calling CreateTrail. The maximum length is 128 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeGlobalServiceEvents:Trail'</a>,
--   <a>trail_includeGlobalServiceEvents</a> - Set to <b>True</b> to
--   include Amazon Web Services API calls from Amazon Web Services global
--   services such as IAM. Otherwise, <b>False</b>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hasCustomEventSelectors:Trail'</a>,
--   <a>trail_hasCustomEventSelectors</a> - Specifies if the trail has
--   custom event selectors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isOrganizationTrail:Trail'</a>,
--   <a>trail_isOrganizationTrail</a> - Specifies whether the trail is an
--   organization trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cloudWatchLogsRoleArn:Trail'</a>,
--   <a>trail_cloudWatchLogsRoleArn</a> - Specifies the role for the
--   CloudWatch Logs endpoint to assume to write to a user's log group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3BucketName:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_s3BucketName</a> - Name of
--   the Amazon S3 bucket into which CloudTrail delivers your trail files.
--   See <a>Amazon S3 Bucket Naming Requirements</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isMultiRegionTrail:Trail'</a>, <a>trail_isMultiRegionTrail</a>
--   - Specifies whether the trail exists only in one region or exists in
--   all regions.
newTrail :: Trail

-- | Information about a CloudTrail trail, including the trail's name, home
--   region, and Amazon Resource Name (ARN).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrailInfo</a> smart constructor.
data TrailInfo
TrailInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TrailInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>TrailInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:trailARN:TrailInfo'</a>, <a>trailInfo_trailARN</a> - The ARN
--   of a trail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:homeRegion:TrailInfo'</a>, <a>trailInfo_homeRegion</a> - The
--   Amazon Web Services Region in which a trail was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:TrailInfo'</a>, <a>trailInfo_name</a> - The name of a
--   trail.
newTrailInfo :: TrailInfo
